wikipedia_page.main: Jonathan Brown (1893 – 6 November 1918) was an English professional football left half who made one appearance in the Football League for Burnley in 1914.

response: *Jonathan Brown (art historian) (born 1939), American expert on the work of the painter Diego Velázquez
*Jonathan Brown (Australian footballer) (born 1981), Australian rules football player
*Jonathan Brown (Scottish footballer) (born 1990), Scottish association footballer (Hearts, Livingston, Stirling)
*Jonathan Brown (gridiron football) (born 1975), defensive lineman in the NFL, CFL and AFL

The team finished fourth in 1914–15 before English football was suspended during the First World War.Simpson (2007), pp. 134–135 First team players Jonathan Brown, William Pickering, reserve players William Johnson, Harry Langtree and Alfred Lorrimer were killed during the conflict, while Teddy Hodgson died after he contracted a kidney problem.Simpson (2007), p. 146 Upon resumption of full-time football in 1919–20, Burnley finished second to West Bromwich Albion and for the first time won the First Division championship in 1920–21. Burnley lost the season's opening three matches before they went on a 30-match run without defeat, an English record for unbeaten league games in a single season that lasted until Arsenal went invincible during the 2003–04 FA Premier League season. Burnley could not retain the title and finished third the next season, followed by a 15th place finish in 1922–23.
